$DAC from the FY2018 10K report - DAC took a combined $626M in impairment losses in FY2016 and FY2018
created_at: primarily on vessels. I haven't looked in-depth as to whether DAC still owns all of these ships
column3: but it seems likely that DAC book value of PPE / assets / equity are understated

body: using balance sheet values from the FY2021 10-K
created_at: DAC currently trades at  0.77x book equity. Adjusting for dividends and expected Q1 earnings
column3: I conservatively estimate that DAC is currently trading closer to ~0.68x book equity. if we assume that of this $626M impairment charge
column4: ~$300M (48%) of the impairment was taken ahead of the turnaround in the container / vessel market
column5: DAC is trading at an even further discount to the true economic value of its assets (~0.60x "true" book equity
column6: which is wildly cheap for a company with relatively fixed earnings...)

body: this also assumes that $ZIM has stayed flat since 12/31/2021 (+12% YTD) :)
